main_definition: A period of one thousand years or a span of a thousand days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a period of one thousand years, often associated with the beginning of a new era.
meanings_and_examples.example: The year 2000 marked the end of the second millennium and the start of the third.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in various contexts to denote a long period, typically for planning or futuristic predictions.
meanings_and_examples.example: In the field of technology, many experts predict that we are entering the Information Age Millennium.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used metaphorically to describe something as lasting a long time or being enduring.
meanings_and_examples.example: The ancient ruins stood as a testament to the millenniums of history they had witnessed.
